content.raw:
Just a note that this model is using the same meshes for visuals and collisions almost everywhere. It would be interesting for the physics engine performance to use simple shapes as collisions.

There are also several small links embedded into other ones which probably don't need a collision at all. For example, `rightAnklePitchLink` has a mesh as collision, but there's probably no way something can collide with it in a meaningful way. 

![val_ankle.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/2113803032-val_ankle.png)
content.html:
Just a note that this model is using the same meshes for visuals and collisions almost everywhere. It would be interesting for the physics engine performance to use simple shapes as collisions.

There are also several small links embedded into other ones which probably don't need a collision at all. For example, rightAnklePitchLink has a mesh as collision, but there's probably no way something can collide with it in a meaningful way.
